data.title: This dwarf galaxy contains both cradles and the graves of stars
data.meta_description: This star-studded image of the Sextans B dwarf galaxy showcases astronomical curiosities near and far.
data.text:
Using the Nicholas U. Mayall 4-meter Telescope at Kitt Peak National Observatory, a Program of NSFâ€™s NOIRLab, astronomers captured the image of dwarf galaxy Sextans B. Located around 4.5 million light-years from Earth, the universe contains the collection of astronomical objects such as bright stars, cradles and the graves of stars.

The galaxy has a mass of around 200 million times the mass of the Sun. It also contains ruby-red clouds of atomic hydrogen that give birth to brilliant new stars.

Sextans B is also known to have several planetary nebulae.
